entry.title: "...dream again" Open Call
entry.content:
The Secret Theatre in association with LIC Artists Inc
üìç Long Island City, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

Open Call for an LIC Arts Open collaboration with The Secret Theatre

Hosted by LiC-A at the Plaxall Gallery and curated by Norma Homberg


Location: The Plaxall Gallery
Exhibition on View: March 7th, 2019 to March 31st, 2019
Reception: Saturday, March 9th, 7-10PM
Mediums: Paintings, collage, and wall sculptures only. Please, no installation work.
Submission Fee: $15.00 for LiC-A members, $30.00 for non-members
Submission Deadline : Friday, February 22, 2019

Exhibition concept:
When submitting to this exhibition running alongside the Secret Theatre‚Äôs production of William Shakespeare‚Äôs The Tempest, think darker shades of blues and purples. Think medium and larger scale work - small works will get lost in this exhibition. Your work will be part of an incredibly strong Fine Art Exhibition and sets the backdrop for a full length, immersive production of The Tempest while the play is in session in the evenings at the gallery. We are going for monochrome paintings, storm and magical realism. Please avoid overly 'busy' or ‚Äúwhimsy‚Äù artwork.
The curator is also looking for artwork which would be specifically for Caliban‚Äôs cave. The cave has precious treasures stored in little nooks which Gallery visitors can open and explore.


This form is for artists to submit images of their work for consideration. The final selection of work will be determined by the curator. To show your full range, we suggest submitting the maximum of five works.

Submission fee (non-refundable) is $30 for non-members, $15 for members.

SUBMISSIONS: Please include images of your work to be submitted using the instructions below:

Artist‚Äôs contact information (Note: address, email, phone will not be published)
Up to 5 images, JPEGs only, under 1 MB each; 72dpi is adequate, image width not to exceed 1024 pixels on the longest side. Label each file as follows: LastName_FirstName_TitleOfWork.jpg. Example: Smith_Jane_Tranquility.jpg.
Description of Work. Descriptions must include: Uploaded Title, date, medium, dimensions (H x W x D) price. For example: ‚ÄúTranquility‚Äù, 2018, Oil on Linen, 20 x 16 inches, $700.00.
Note: Artist's name, website, description of work and price will appear on exhibition wall labels exactly as entered in this form. Please proof your entries before submitting the form. No other personal information will be printed. Accepted artwork may be featured on our website.

DELIVERY DATES: all selected artwork must be delivered to the Plaxall Gallery: Saturday, March 2nd from 12-5PM, Sunday, March 3rd from 12-8PM

APPLICATION DEADLINE: Friday, February 22nd 11:59 PM

NOTIFICATION OF ACCEPTANCE: February 26th

PICK UP DATE: Sunday, March 31st 7th 5-8PM and Monday, April 1st 10AM-1: 30 PM

OPENING RECEPTION: Saturday, March 9th, 7-10PM

ADDRESS: Plaxall Gallery, 5-25 46th Avenue, Long Island City, Queens - between Vernon and 5th Street. The entrance to the gallery space is on the parking lot (west) side of the building at the second loading bay.

Please e-mail info@licartists.org with any questions.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

PLEASE APPLY HERE: http://licartists.formstack.com

Please do not reply to the email address listed here.

entry.title: 3/29 - Real Art Awards
entry.content:
Real Art Ways
üìç Hartford, CT, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 03/29/2019 deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

Emerging artists living and working in New England, New York or New Jersey who are no more than three years removed from a full-time educational program, or artists with less than five years of exhibition experience are eligible to apply to this call. Artists working in all media are welcome.

NO ENTRY FEE.

Six artists will receive:
- $2,500 prize
- Solo exhibit at Real Art Ways in 2019 or 2020
- Exhibition publication with commissioned essay and documentation
- Curatorial assistance
- Opportunity for an artist talk

JURORS:
Terry Jenoure, Artist / Curator, Director, Augusta Savage Gallery
Olu Oguibe, Artist / Critic
Will K. Wilkins, Executive Director of Real Art Ways

This project is supported in part by an award from the National Endowment for the Arts.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

For more information and submission guidelines, including image and video requirements, download the submissions guide at realartways.org.

Questions?
Please address questions to: Neil Daigle-Orians, Visual Arts Coordinator, norians@realartways.org

entry.title: 2/20 - Call for Entries: Reimagining Region
entry.content:
Art School of Columbia County
üìç Ghent, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 02/20/2019 deadline
üí∞ $15.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

Reimagining Region: The Hudson Valley has been a site of intersecting cultures, movement, migration, environmental innovation, and resettlement. Artists have depicted and responded to this for generations, creating a rich regional artistic heritage. In an upcoming juried show, the Art School of Columbia County is exploring the idea of region: its boundaries (real or perceived), the role of artists in documenting and defining region and identity, the concept of a regional school, and the connection between artists and community.
Artists age 18 and up living or working in within a 100 mile radius of Ghent NY, are invited to apply to ASCC‚Äôs juried regional show exploring the theme of Reimagining Region.
Works will be selected for artistic merit and how they explore and relate to the selected theme.
Selected artists may be chosen to participate in ASCC‚Äôs 5th annual ARTalks series, featuring a guided panel discussion and reception. Work in the exhibit will be viewed as part of an educational program on Saturday, April 6, ‚ÄúSlow Art Day,‚Äù an international day held to promote mindfulness and deep engagement with art in museums and educational institutions. An artists‚Äô reception is April 6 from 5- 7 pm. The reception is free and open to the public and refreshments are served.
Juror: Kate Menconeri, Curator/Director of Exhibitions and Collections, Thomas Cole National Historic Site (Catskill NY). Ms. Menconeri has curated exhibits of both historical and contemporary artists, including collaborations with Kiki Smith. She holds a MA is Curatorial Studies from Bard.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

All applicants: first submit application fee via this page: http://artschoolofcolumbiacounty.org
OR, join as a member of ASCC
OR submit indicating you are a current member.
Joining as an ASCC member provides opportunities for 5 exhibits per membership year.
Work may be for sale: 70% to the artist, 30% to ASCC. NFS permitted, but no POR please.
Notification of accepted artworks: March 4, 2019
Email up to 5 works only as JPGs to: artschoolofcolumbiacounty@gmail.com subject line Juried Show 2019. 3-D work may submit one additional view of a submitted artwork. Video applicants: link to up to 5 works online.
1) Include in the email up to 200 words stating how the body of submitted work relates to the theme of Reimagining Region.
2) Attach your artist‚Äôs CV/resume
3) Save/title all images as: artist first initial, last name and number: e.g. Jane Smith = jsmith_1.jpg, jsmith_2.jpg, etc.
Images must be no larger than 1200 pixels on the largest side and at no less than 75 dpi (300 dpi recommended). The file size may not exceed 5MB.
4) Within the body of the email, include for each work submitted the following details:
Number of submission (e.g. 1-5)
Title
Medium
Height/Width/Depth/Weight
Year completed

Please note that all accepted works must be stable, and framed/mounted and wired for wall hanging. For 3-D work and special installations, some pedestals are available at ASCC. In some cases, ASCC may ask artists to provide a plain white or off-white pedestal. Video installation must provide their own equipment for viewing (no online access onsite at ASCC). Please visit ASCC or call us for more information about our gallery spaces. In accordance with best curatorial practices, ASCC Board members and staff will not apply for consideration for juried shows.

By US Mail: print 8 x 10‚Ä≥ images of up to 5 works for consideration plus additional requested information to ASCC, 1198 Rt 21 C, Ghent NY 12075.

Reception: Saturday April 6 5-7 pm. All refreshments provided.
Additional receptions for viewing work Sundays April 14 and 28 as part of ARTalks series.
Pick-up: Thursday May 9 9 am ‚Äì 6 pm or Saturday May 11 12- 4 pm
Drop-off of accepted artwork: Thursday March 28 9 am ‚Äì 5 pm (preferred) or appointments available on Saturday March 30. If accepted, work must be hand delivered to and picked-up from ASCC. We are unable to accept shipped works or courier services which leave packing materials behind. Video installations must set-up and demonstrate work and provide written instructional sheet to ASCC staff.
